newsitem.title: FRANCE: Parliament adopts species trade report.
newsitem.headline: Parliament adopts species trade report.

text.p: The European Parliament adopted on Wednesday its report on rules regulating the trade in wild animals and plants, passing a series of amendments to the European Commission's proposal in the process.
The vote completed parliament's second reading, under the cooperation procedure, of European Commission proposal COM(91)448 for a Regulation on the trade of wild animals and plants.
The proposal lays down provisions for the issue of import and export licences for traders, which are intended to tighten the application of CITES rules for trade in endangered species.

Dutch Socialist Maartje van Putten had put forward 24 amendments intended to cut species death rates during transport, to provide for freer public access to trade data and for increased member state and Commission reporting on trade patterns.
A further 14 amendments were added by others by the time of the vote.
Euro-MPs adopted amendments 1 to 5, 7 to 13, 15 to 17 and 20 to 23, rejecting all the others.
